org.jpws.front

Class TreeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.front.TreeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionListener, ContainerView, ActivitySource, org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedListListener

    public class TreeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.TreeSelectionListener, ContainerView, org.jpws.pwslib.order.OrderedListListener
    Defines a TreeModel and organises the display of a JTree relating to the content of a PwsFileContainer.
    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller

      • hasUserSelection

        public boolean hasUserSelection()
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView
        Whether there exists a meaningful user selection in this view's display. (Note that this is not equivalent with getFirstSelected() != -1 as it refers to *any* meaningful selections within implementations whose nature is unknown to this interface.)
        Specified by:
        hasUserSelection in interface ContainerView

      • getTreeExpansionInfo

        Returns:
        String

      • installTreeExpansionInfo

        public void installTreeExpansionInfo(java.lang.String info)
        Imposes the given node set expansion info onto the entire structure of the tree.
        Parameters:
        info - String, coded expansion information for tree nodes

      • markTreeExpansionState

        public void markTreeExpansionState()
        Marks the current state of the tree expansion memory. If there exists a recent mark without reset, this does nothing!

      • resetTreeExpansionState

        public void resetTreeExpansionState()
        Resets tree expansion memory to the latest marked version. (Does nothing if there has been no call to markExpansionState().)

      • getSelectedNode

      • getSelectedItems

        public int[] getSelectedItems()
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView

        Returns:

      • setSelectedIndex

        public void setSelectedIndex(int index)
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView
        Sets the record item selected that belongs to the specified sort index in the OrderedRecordList that forms the data reference of this view handler.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedIndex in interface ContainerView
        Parameters:
        index - of the item to be selected; -1 leads to empty selection (deselection)

      • getSelectedWrappers

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getSelectedWrappers()
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView
        Returns all items of the current user selection in this view as an array of DefaultRecordWrappers. This may serve as an absolute reference to the records of a list selection (instead of the relative of index positions).
        Specified by:
        getSelectedWrappers in interface ContainerView
        Returns:
        array of DefaultRecordWrapper; empty array if the selection is empty

      • setSelectedWrappers

        public void setSelectedWrappers(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] selection)
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView
        Sets an array of DefaultRecordWrapper items as the current user selection in the view. Records that are not elements of the current view list are disregarded.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedWrappers in interface ContainerView
        Parameters:
        selection - array of DefaultRecordWrapper

      • setExpanded

        public void setExpanded(java.lang.String group,
                        boolean v)
        Sets a group tree node to all expanded or all collapsed. This will cause all subdirectories of a branch to adopt the specified state.
        Parameters:
        group - GROUP field name for an existing record group;may be null
        v - value true == expanded, false == collapsed

      • setSelectedItems

        public void setSelectedItems(int[] selection)
        Description copied from interface: ContainerView
        Sets an array of items as the current user selection in the view. With selection == null this works as deselection.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedItems in interface ContainerView
        Parameters:
        selection - array of item indices in OrderedRecordList or null
